title: Drawing, Page of a drawing book; A title page for series Venationes Ferarum Arium Piscium, 1597
title_raw: Page of a drawing book; A title page for series Venationes Ferarum Arium Piscium
medium: Pen, ink, bistre wash on paper
inscribed: gidone fistuli (?) 1/2 gambelotte g. II B 5 ...B 5/...lana biancha B 4/ e telle nere g. 8 B 4 monti (?)/adi g per lamanifatura [struck out and written over it:] p (?) seta 4 g 23 1/2 / E bottone 41 (1597) E adi 2 dapril pagai g 7 al sarte/a conto del gambelotte ba. 5 [then two lines struck out]/1579/A di 2 daprile io pago sc 16 papale/Recata dal procaccia iscopo di/Baccio/ E pagato una testone di Roma/ El gibone el gambelotte costo g 11 B 5 / lo pano biancho a telle nere costo g 8 B 4/bottoni sete manifatura costo g 4 / in tutto g 23 1/2. Adi 12 de giunio 1597 mandai Lalaico (?)
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Horizontal rectangle. An escutcheon is in the center. It is flanked by dragons. The head of an elephant is shown above, in the center, heads of a boar and of an ape, respectively, upon upper scrolls. In the intervals, between the escutcheon and the lateral framings are two buffaloes and a lion, at left, a dragon and a tiger, at right. Below is a boar with an ovoid. A fox is shown at left, a hyena at right. Written in the escutcheon: "morte/42 pezze sc 82/cento. a sc conto sc 29/Reste avere sc 53." The figures "1" to "12" and again "1" to "7" are written vertically at the upper edge. Recto: "gidone fistuli (?) 1/2 gambelotte g. II B 5 ...B 5/...lana biancha B 4/ e telle nere g. 8 B 4 monti (?)/adi g per lamanifatura [struck out and written over it:] p (?) seta 4 g 23 1/2 / E bottone 41 (1597) E adi 2 dapril pagai g 7 al sarte/a conto del gambelotte ba. 5 [then two lines struck out]/1579/A di 2 daprile io pago sc 16 papale/Recata dal procaccia iscopo di/Baccio/ E pagato una testone di Roma/ El gibone el gambelotte costo g 11 B 5 / lo pano biancho a telle nere costo g 8 B 4/bottoni sete manifatura costo g 4 / in tutto g 23 1/2. Adi 12 de giunio 1597 mandai Lalaico (?)."

participants.person_name: Jan van der Straet, called Stradanus

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Page of a drawing book; A title page for series Venationes Ferarum Arium Piscium, 1597. Pen, ink, bistre wash on paper. 
Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-2280
